00098 /** \name Create new sequence from scratch. */
00099 //-------------------------------
00100 //@{
00101 
00102 /**
00103  * \ingroup  Sequence
00104  * \brief  Create a new sequence.
00105  *
00106  * \description
00107  *
00108  *    Create a new, in-memory, sequence.
00109  *
00110  * \modifications  
00111  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
00112  */
00113 FC_ReturnCode fc_createSequence(
00114   FC_Dataset dataset,    /**< input - dataset to create sequence in */
00115   char *seqname,         /**< input - name of sequence */
00116   FC_Sequence *sequence  /**< output - new sequence handle */
00117 ) {
00118   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00119   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
00120   int *temp_slotIDs;
00121   
00122   // default return value
00123   if (sequence)
00124     *sequence = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00125   
00126   // check input
00127   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
00128   if (dsSlot == NULL || !seqname || !sequence) {
00129     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00130     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00131   }
00132   
00133   // log message
00134   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating new sequence '%s'", seqname);
00135 
00136   // get an open slot
00137   seqSlot = _fc_getNewSeqSlot();
00138   if (seqSlot == NULL) {
00139     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00140     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00141   }
00142   
00143   // table header information
00144   _FC_GET_HANDLE(*sequence, seqSlot);
00145   _fc_setSlotHeaderName(&(seqSlot->header), seqname);
00146   
00147   // set back and forth references
00148   seqSlot->ds = dataset;
00149   
00150   // update owning dataset with info about this sequence
00151   temp_slotIDs = realloc(dsSlot->seqIDs, sizeof(int) * (dsSlot->numSeq + 1));
00152   if (temp_slotIDs == NULL) {
00153     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00154     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00155   }
00156   temp_slotIDs[dsSlot->numSeq] = seqSlot->header.slotID;
00157   dsSlot->seqIDs = temp_slotIDs;
00158   dsSlot->numSeq++;
00159   
00160   return FC_SUCCESS;
00161 }
00162 
00163 /**
00164  * \ingroup  Sequence
00165  * \brief  Set the sequence coordinates by copy.
00166  *
00167  * \description
00168  *  
00169  *    Set the coordinates for the sequence. Must provide the number of steps,
00170  *    the data type, and a pointer to the 1-D array of coordinates.
00171  *    This routine makes a copy of the coords for the library,
00172  *    so the user still has responsibility of the original buffer.
00173  *    If you would like to give the coordinates array to the sequence instead
00174  *    of just copying them, use fc_setSequenceCoordsPtr().
00175  *
00176  *    You cannot set coords if they already exist.
00177  *
00178  * \modifications 
00179  *    - 2003-NOV-13  WSK  Created
00180  *    - 09/10/04 WSK, changed so cannot set coords more than once.
00181  */
00182 FC_ReturnCode fc_setSequenceCoords(
00183   FC_Sequence sequence,  /**< Input - Sequence handle */
00184   int numStep,           /**< Input - Number of steps in the sequence */
00185   FC_DataType dataType,  /**< Input - The data type of the coordinate array
00186                                       (i.e. int, float, etc) */
00187   void *coords           /**< Input - Array of coordinate data */
00188 ) {
00189   int size;
00190   _FC_SeqSlot *seqSlot;
00191   
00192   // NOTE!: if you change stuff here, also change fc_setSetSequenceCoordsPtr()
00193 
00194   // check input
00195   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
00196   if (seqSlot == NULL || numStep < 1 || !fc_isDataTypeValid(dataType) ||
00197       dataType == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || coords == NULL) {
00198     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00199     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00200   }
00201  
00202   // a little more checking -- can't overwrite coords 
00203   if (seqSlot->coords != NULL || seqSlot->header.committed == 1) {
00204     fc_printfErrorMessage("Coords already exist on sequence '%s'",
00205                           seqSlot->header.name);
00206     return FC_ERROR;
00207   }
00208 
00209   // log message
00210   fc_printfLogMessage("Setting coords on sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
00211 
00212   // Meta data
00213   seqSlot->numStep = numStep;
00214   seqSlot->datatype = dataType;
00215 
00216   // Big data
00217   size = fc_sizeofDataType(dataType);
00218   size *= numStep;
00219   seqSlot->coords = malloc(size);
00220   if (seqSlot->coords == NULL) {
00221     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00222       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00223   }
00224   memcpy(seqSlot->coords, coords, size);
00225 
00226   return FC_SUCCESS;
00227 }
00228 
00229 /**
00230  * \ingroup  Sequence
00231  * \brief  Set the pointer to the mesh coordinates.
00232  *
00233  * \description
00234  *  
00235  *    Set the coordinates for the sequence. Must provide the number of steps,
00236  *    the data type, and a pointer to the 1-D array of coordinates. 
00237  *    This routine passes the coords array directly to the library,
00238  *    so the user no longer has responsibility of the original buffer.
00239  *    If you would like to keep the coords array, you should use 
00240  *    fc_setSequenceCoords() instead which makes a copy of the coords array.
00241  *
00242  *    You cannot set coords if they already exist.
00243  *
00244  * \modifications 
00245  *    - 10/01/04 WSK, created.
00246  */
00247 FC_ReturnCode fc_setSequenceCoordsPtr(
00248   FC_Sequence sequence,  /**< Input - Sequence handle */
00249   int numStep,           /**< Input - Number of steps in the sequence */
00250   FC_DataType dataType,  /**< Input - The data type of the coordinate array
00251                                       (i.e. int, float, etc) */
00252   void *coords           /**< Input - Array of coordinate data */
00253 ) {
00254   _FC_SeqSlot *seqSlot;
00255   
00256   // NOTE!: if you change stuff here, also change fc_setSetSequenceCoords()
00257 
00258   // check input
00259   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
00260   if (seqSlot == NULL || numStep < 1 || !fc_isDataTypeValid(dataType) ||
00261       dataType == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || coords == NULL) {
00262     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00263     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00264   }
00265  
00266   // a little more checking -- can't overwrite coords 
00267   if (seqSlot->coords != NULL || seqSlot->header.committed == 1) {
00268     fc_printfErrorMessage("Coords already exist on sequence '%s'",
00269                           seqSlot->header.name);
00270     return FC_ERROR;
00271   }
00272 
00273   // log message
00274   fc_printfLogMessage("Setting coords on sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
00275 
00276   // Meta data
00277   seqSlot->numStep = numStep;
00278   seqSlot->datatype = dataType;
00279 
00280   // Big data
00281   seqSlot->coords = coords;
00282 
00283   return FC_SUCCESS;
00284 }

00288 /** \name Other ways to get new sequences. */
00289 //-------------------------------
00290 //@{
00291 
00292 /**
00293  * \ingroup  Sequence
00294  * \brief  Copy a sequence
00295  *
00296  * \description
00297  *  
00298  *    Create a copy of a sequence, in the specified dataset, with the 
00299  *    given name.
00300  *
00301  * \todo
00302  *    Perhaps somehow flag when the destination dataset is the same
00303  *    as the source dataset. Also do this for other copies. Very useful
00304  *    for fc_copyVariable.
00305  *
00306  * \modifications 
00307  *   - 2003-NOV-11 WSK Created
00308  */
00309 FC_ReturnCode fc_copySequence(
00310   FC_Sequence src_seq, /**< Input - the source sequence to be copied */
00311   FC_Dataset dest_ds, /**< Input - the destination dataset to be copied into */
00312   char *newName,       /**< Input - the name of the new sequence, a NULL value
00313                             is a flag to use the name of the source sequence */
00314   FC_Sequence* new_seq /**< Output - handle to the new sequence */
00315 ) { 
00316   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00317   _FC_DsSlot* dest_dsSlot;
00318   _FC_SeqSlot* src_seqSlot;
00319   int numStep;
00320   FC_DataType dataType;
00321   void* coords;
00322 
00323   // default return
00324   if (new_seq)
00325     *new_seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00326 
00327   // check input
00328   dest_dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dest_ds);
00329   src_seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(src_seq);
00330   if (dest_dsSlot == NULL || src_seqSlot == NULL || new_seq == NULL) {
00331     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00332     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00333   }
00334 
00335   // test for NULL name
00336   if (newName == NULL)
00337     newName = src_seqSlot->header.name;
00338 
00339   // log message
00340   fc_printfLogMessage("Copying sequence '%s' to '%s'", 
00341                       src_seqSlot->header.name, newName);
00342 
00343   // get src data
00344   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(src_seq, &numStep, &dataType);
00345   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00346     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get info for sequence '%s'",
00347                           src_seqSlot->header.name);
00348     return rc;
00349   }
00350   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(src_seq, &coords);
00351   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00352     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get coords for sequence '%s'",
00353                           src_seqSlot->header.name);
00354     return rc;
00355   }
00356 
00357   // create new sequence 
00358   rc = fc_createSequence(dest_ds, newName, new_seq);
00359   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00360     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to create sequence '%s'", newName);
00361     return rc;
00362   }
00363   rc = fc_setSequenceCoords(*new_seq, numStep, dataType, coords);
00364   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00365     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to set coords for sequence '%s'", newName);
00366     return rc;
00367   }
00368 
00369   return rc;
00370 }
00371 
00372 
00373 /** 
00374  * \ingroup Sequence
00375  * \brief Given a seq, return a new sequence that is the old one shifted and scaled.
00376  *
00377  * \description
00378  *
00379  *    Given a seq, return a new sequence that is the old one shifted and
00380  *    scaled.  Possible usage: This function can be followed by
00381  *    fc_copySeqVariable in order to create a new seqVar that is an oldSeqVar
00382  *    normalized in time such that it starts at time zero.
00383  *    
00384  *    The shift is applied before the scale. 
00385  *    i.e., new_seq_val = (old_seq_val+shift)*(scale).
00386  *    If you don't want to shift, pass in 0 for the shift; if you
00387  *    dont want to scale pass in 1 for the scale.
00388  *
00389  *
00390  *    The datatype of the new sequence is FC_DT_DOUBLE regardless of
00391  *    the original sequence datatype.
00392  *
00393  *    This returns with an error if the orignal sequence is not numerical.
00394  *    Scaling by zero is not allowed.
00395  *
00396  * \todo change this so the user can specify the return type.
00397  *
00398  * \modifications
00399  *    6/14/05 ACG created. 
00400  *
00401  */
00402 FC_ReturnCode fc_shiftAndScaleSequence(
00403   FC_Sequence src_seq, /**< Input - the source sequence to be shifted and scaled */
00404   FC_Dataset dest_ds, /**< Input - the destination dataset to be copied into */
00405   double shift, /**< input - val shifting seq by */ 
00406   double scale, /**< input - val scaling seq by */ 
00407   char *newName,       /**< Input - the name of the new sequence */
00408   FC_Sequence* new_seq /**< Output - handle to the new sequence */
00409 ) { 
00410   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00411 
00412   _FC_DsSlot* dest_dsSlot;
00413   _FC_SeqSlot* src_seqSlot;
00414   int numStep;
00415   FC_DataType seqdatatype;
00416   double* prev;
00417   void* coordsp;
00418   int i;
00419 
00420   // default return
00421   if (new_seq)
00422     *new_seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00423 
00424   // check input
00425   dest_dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dest_ds);
00426   src_seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(src_seq);
00427   if (dest_dsSlot == NULL || src_seqSlot == NULL ||
00428       new_seq == NULL || newName == NULL) {
00429     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00430     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00431   }
00432 
00433   // log message
00434   fc_printfLogMessage("shifting and scaling sequence '%s' to '%s'", 
00435                       src_seqSlot->header.name, newName);
00436 
00437   if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(scale,0.0)){
00438     fc_printfErrorMessage("scaling by zero is not allowed");
00439     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00440   }
00441 
00442   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo (src_seq, &numStep, &seqdatatype);
00443   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00444     return rc;
00445   }
00446 
00447   if (!(seqdatatype == FC_DT_INT || seqdatatype == FC_DT_FLOAT ||
00448         seqdatatype == FC_DT_DOUBLE)){
00449     fc_printfErrorMessage("seq data type is not numerical");
00450     return FC_ERROR;
00451   }
00452 
00453   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(src_seq,&coordsp);
00454   if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
00455     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00456     return FC_ERROR;
00457   }
00458 
00459 
00460   prev = (double*)malloc(numStep*sizeof(double));
00461   if (prev == NULL){
00462     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s","cant make data array");
00463     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00464     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00465   }
00466 
00467   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++){
00468     switch(seqdatatype){
00469     case FC_DT_INT:
00470       prev[i] = (double)(((int*)coordsp)[i]);
00471       break;
00472     case FC_DT_FLOAT:
00473       prev[i] = (double)(((float*)coordsp)[i]);
00474       break;
00475     default: //know its a double
00476       prev[i] = ((double*)coordsp)[i];
00477       break;
00478     }
00479 
00480     //this isnt quite ideal - e.g., if magnitude of both shift and scale are small...
00481     if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(prev[i],-shift)){
00482       prev[i] = 0.0;
00483     }else{
00484       prev[i]+=shift;
00485       if (!FC_DBL_EQUIV(scale,1.0)){
00486         prev[i]*=scale;
00487       }
00488     }
00489   }
00490 
00491   // create new sequence 
00492   rc = fc_createSequence(dest_ds, newName, new_seq);
00493   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
00494     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to create sequence '%s'", newName);
00495     free(prev);
00496     return rc;
00497   }
00498 
00499   // set new seq coords
00500   rc = fc_setSequenceCoordsPtr(*new_seq,numStep,FC_DT_DOUBLE,(void*)prev);
00501   if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
00502     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00503     free(prev);
00504     fc_deleteSequence(*new_seq);
00505     *new_seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00506     return FC_ERROR;
00507   }
00508   
00509   return rc;
00510 }
00511 
00512 
00513 /** 
00514  * \ingroup Sequence
00515  * \brief Creates a sequence of specified length, starting at a given
00516  *        val with subsequent vals spaced by given stepsize
00517  *
00518  * \description
00519  *
00520  *        Creates a sequence of specified with starting at a given
00521  *        val with subsequent vals spaced by given stepsize. Stepsize
00522  *        cannot = 0 unless it requesting a single stepsize sequence.
00523  *        If want a single stepsize sequence the spacing requested
00524  *        doesnt matter.
00525  *
00526  *        Return seq data type is FC_DT_DOUBLE.
00527  *
00528  *        This routine is often used as a companion function to 
00529  *        functions in the timeseries module. This function can
00530  *        be used to create a common sequence for two sequence
00531  *        variables. The old variables can be put on the new sequence
00532  *        using fc_LinearInterpolation and then used in the comparison
00533  *        routines in the timeseries module.
00534  *
00535  *        This is also is a companion function to the private function
00536  *        _fc_createSeqVariableFromRegularVariable in the timeseries module
00537  *        used in some test modules.In this way 2 sequence variables can be 
00538  *        created from 2 different multi-datapoint variables and used in
00539  *        the comparison routines in the timeseries module, since they will
00540  *        be on the same sequence. 
00541  *
00542  * \todo should there be another version where you set the bounds rather than
00543  *       the stepsize to avoid roundoff issues ?
00544  *
00545  * \modifications  
00546  *    - 2/2/05 ACG, created from being split out from 
00547  *      fc_createSeqvariableFromVariable
00548  *    - 2/10/05 ACG changed so takes an offset and a step size.
00549  *    - 2/10/05 ACG moved to private becuase thats where the companion
00550  *              functions _fc_createSeqVariableFromRegularVariable is.
00551  *              This may be useful and perhaps put in Sequence module, on
00552  *              the other hand its sufficiently short that maybe it cannot
00553  *              justify its existence.
00554  *    - 4/12/05 ACG and now we need it for comparing variables on
00555  *              different sequences.
00556  *    - 4/21/05 ACG moved it here from its previous home in timeseries.
00557  *    - 4/27/05 ACG better handling of single data point sequences
00558  *
00559  */
00560 FC_ReturnCode fc_createRegularSequence(
00561   FC_Dataset dset, /**< input - dataset for the sequence */
00562   int numStep, /**< input - numstep in created seq */
00563   double offset, /**< initial val in the sequence */ 
00564   double stepsize, /**< spacing of the sequence */ 
00565   char* seq_name, /**< input - name of the new sequence that will be created */
00566   FC_Sequence *seq /**< output - handle to the new sequence */
00567 ){
00568 
00569   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00570   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00571   double *times;
00572   int k;
00573 
00574 
00575   // default return
00576   if (seq)
00577     *seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00578 
00579   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dset);
00580   if (dsSlot == NULL || !seq_name || !seq || numStep < 1){
00581     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00582     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00583   }
00584 
00585   if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(stepsize,0.0) && numStep != 1){
00586     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant ask for more than 1 step but zero step size");
00587     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00588   }
00589 
00590   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating regular sequence");
00591 
00592   rc = fc_createSequence(dset,seq_name,seq);
00593   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00594     fc_deleteSequence(*seq);
00595     *seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00596     return rc;
00597   }
00598 
00599 
00600   times = (double*)malloc(numStep*sizeof(double));
00601   times[0] = offset;
00602   for (k = 1; k < numStep; k++){
00603     times[k] = times[k-1]+stepsize;
00604   }
00605       
00606   rc = fc_setSequenceCoords(*seq,numStep,FC_DT_DOUBLE,times);
00607   free(times);
00608   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00609     fc_deleteSequence(*seq);
00610     *seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00611     return rc;
00612   }
00613 
00614   return FC_SUCCESS;
00615 
00616 }

00619 /** 
00620  * \ingroup Sequence
00621  * \brief Given an array of sequences on the same dataset, creates a new 
00622  *        regularly spaced sequence whose range is the intersection
00623  *        of the sequences.
00624  *
00625  * \description
00626  *
00627  *        Given an array of sequences on the same dataset, creates a new 
00628  *        regularly spaced sequence whose range is the intersection
00629  *        of the sequences. Input sequences must be numerical, but dont
00630  *        have to be same datatype. Input sequences must be 
00631  *        monotonically increasing. New seq data type is FC_DT_DOUBLE.
00632  *        Seq is null if no valid range. If numStep == 0, then it
00633  *        returns a sequence with the greatest number of steps that
00634  *        an input sequence has on that range. 
00635  *
00636  *        This routine is often used as a companion function to 
00637  *        functions in the timeseries module. This function creates
00638  *        a common sequence for two or more sequence variables. The
00639  *        old variables can be put on the new sequence
00640  *        using fc_LinearInterpolation and then used in the comparison
00641  *        routines in the timeseries module.
00642  *
00643  * \todo
00644  *     see if can combine this with rc_getIntersectingRangeRegularSequence 
00645  *
00646  * \modifications  
00647  *    - 4/25/05 ACG created.
00648  *    - 4/27/05 ACG better handling of single data point sequences
00649  *    - 4/28/05 ACG explicitly set last point of seq to timemax to
00650  *              avoid roundoff issues as a result of createRegularSequence
00651  *              being based on stepsize rather than range. if we make a
00652  *              another version of createRegularSequence that is based on
00653  *              ranage, then use that version here.
00654  *    - 5/13/05 ACG works for non-monotonic sequences so that
00655  *              can use this to check for any overlap to begin with. of course
00656  *              if you are going to map a seq var onto a new seq that was
00657  *              calculated by this method, then the seqvar will have to
00658  *              be made into a monotonic seq to before the interpolation.
00659  *              This change utilizes the new stats function 
00660  *              fc_getSequenceMinMaxMonotonicity.
00661  *    - 5/16/05 ACG making this so has to be monotonically increasing.
00662  *              this makes things easier for doing the automatic
00663  *              numsteps option.
00664  *    - 5/17/05 ACG added default case of numStep == 0 returns max
00665  *              number of steps that the input sequences have on that
00666  *              range. in this way you dont lose any resolution that an
00667  *              input sequence has (well, you kind of do if it wasnt regularly
00668  *              spaced to begin with) and you wont gain any when you do
00669  *              a linear interpolation over the new sequence becuase its just
00670  *              more points over what was a linear segment in the original
00671  *              resolution anyway. 
00672  *    - 6/27/05 ACG updated to use new getClosestSequenceValue
00673  *
00674  */
00675 FC_ReturnCode fc_createIntersectingRegularSequence(
00676   int numseqs,/**< input - num of seqs in orig sequence array */
00677   FC_Sequence *seqs,/**< input - orig sequence array */
00678   int numStep, /**< input - numstep in created seq */
00679   char* seqName, /**<input - name of created sequence */
00680   FC_Sequence *seq /**< output - handle to the new sequence */
00681   ){
00682 
00683   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00684   FC_Dataset dset, dsetcomp;
00685   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00686   double timemin, timemincomp, timemax, timemaxcomp, timespacing;
00687   void *data;
00688   int nstep;
00689   int mono,monocomp;
00690   FC_DataType datatype;
00691   int i;
00692 
00693 
00694   if (seq)
00695     *seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00696 
00697   if (!seqName || !seq || numStep < 0 || numseqs < 1 || !seqs){
00698     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00699     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00700   }
00701 
00702   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating Intersecting regular sequence");
00703 
00704   if (!fc_isSequenceValid(seqs[0])){
00705     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00706     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00707   }
00708 
00709   rc = fc_getDatasetFromSequence (seqs[0], &dset);
00710   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00711     fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot get dataset from sequence");
00712     return FC_ERROR;
00713   }
00714 
00715   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dset);
00716   if (dsSlot == NULL){
00717     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00718     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00719   }
00720 
00721   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(seqs[0], &nstep,&datatype);
00722   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00723     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq info");
00724     return FC_ERROR;
00725   }
00726 
00727   if (datatype != FC_DT_INT && datatype != FC_DT_FLOAT &&
00728       datatype != FC_DT_DOUBLE){
00729     fc_printfErrorMessage("Invalid sequence datatype");
00730     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00731   }
00732 
00733   for (i= 1; i < numseqs; i++){
00734     if (!fc_isSequenceValid(seqs[i])){
00735       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00736       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00737     }
00738     rc = fc_getDatasetFromSequence (seqs[i], &dsetcomp);
00739     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00740       fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot get dataset from sequence");
00741       return FC_ERROR;
00742     }
00743     
00744     if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(dset,dsetcomp)){
00745       fc_printfErrorMessage("Input sequences not on same dataset");
00746       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00747     } 
00748 
00749     rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(seqs[i], &nstep,&datatype);
00750     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00751       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq info");
00752       return FC_ERROR;
00753     }
00754 
00755     if (datatype != FC_DT_INT && datatype != FC_DT_FLOAT &&
00756         datatype != FC_DT_DOUBLE){
00757       fc_printfErrorMessage("Invalid sequence datatype");
00758       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00759     }
00760   }
00761 
00762 
00763   rc = fc_getSequenceMinMaxMono(seqs[0],&timemin,NULL,
00764                                 &timemax,NULL,&mono);
00765   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00766     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get minmax of sequence");
00767     return FC_ERROR;
00768   }
00769 
00770   if (mono != 1 && mono != 2){
00771     fc_printfErrorMessage("invalid monotonicity for this sequence");
00772     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00773   }
00774 
00775 
00776   for (i = 1; i < numseqs; i++){
00777     rc = fc_getSequenceMinMaxMono(seqs[i],&timemincomp,NULL,
00778                                   &timemaxcomp,NULL,&monocomp);
00779     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00780       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get minmax of sequence");
00781       return FC_ERROR;
00782     }
00783 
00784 
00785     //leaving this construction in case switch to allowing decreasing later
00786     if (!(monocomp == 1 || monocomp ==2)){ //increasing or single point
00787       fc_printfErrorMessage("invalid monotonicity for this call");
00788       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00789     } else {
00790       if (mono == 2){
00791         //its gotta be single point sequence
00792         mono = monocomp;
00793       }
00794     }
00795 
00796     //want narrowest bounds
00797     if (timemincomp > timemin) timemin= timemincomp;
00798     if (timemaxcomp < timemax) timemax= timemaxcomp;
00799 
00800     if (timemin > timemax){
00801       //no interesecting bounds - bad input set, but dont want to error
00802       fc_printfErrorMessage("no intersecting range");
00803       return FC_ERROR;
00804     }
00805   }
00806 
00807   //now have valid range
00808   
00809   //if numStep == 0 need to calc numStep
00810   if (numStep == 0){
00811     if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(timemax,timemin)){
00812       numStep = 1; //just make single point sequence
00813     } else {
00814       double closemintime, closemaxtime;
00815       int closeminindex, closemaxindex;
00816       int npts;
00817       int holdnpts = -1;
00818 
00819       for (i = 0; i < numseqs; i++){
00820         rc = fc_getClosestSequenceValue(seqs[i],"<=",timemin,&closemintime,
00821                                         &closeminindex);
00822         if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00823           fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get closest seq val");
00824           return FC_ERROR;
00825         }
00826         rc = fc_getClosestSequenceValue(seqs[i],">=",timemax,&closemaxtime,
00827                                         &closemaxindex);
00828         if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00829           fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get closest seq val");
00830           return FC_ERROR;
00831         }
00832         
00833         //know its monotonically increasing
00834         npts = closemaxindex-closeminindex+1;
00835         if (holdnpts == -1 || npts > holdnpts){
00836           holdnpts = npts;
00837         }
00838       }
00839       numStep = holdnpts;
00840     }
00841   }
00842 
00843 
00844   //check for zero range sequences
00845   if (numStep == 1){
00846     if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(timemax,timemin)){
00847       //good - createRegularsequence should just return the single
00848       //data point
00849       timespacing = 0.0; //actually this value doesnt matter
00850     } else {
00851       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant have nonzero range with only one data point");
00852       return FC_ERROR;
00853     }
00854   } else {
00855     if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(timemin,timemax)){
00856       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant have zero range with more than one data point");
00857       return FC_ERROR;
00858     } else {
00859       //good
00860       timespacing= (timemax-timemin)/((double)numStep-1);
00861     }
00862   }
00863   //printf("new seq: tmin %10g tmax %10g spacing %10g\n",timemin, timemax,
00864   //timespacing);
00865   rc = fc_createRegularSequence(dset,numStep,timemin, timespacing,
00866                                   seqName, seq);
00867   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00868     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to create reg sequence");
00869     return FC_ERROR;
00870   }
00871   
00872   //just in case there are some roundoff issues, lets explicitly set that
00873   //last point to the timemax. (this wont be thread safe since playing 
00874   //with the value thats the return val, but i dont think thats a big issue
00875   //right now
00876   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(*seq, &data);
00877   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00878     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq data");
00879   }else {
00880     ((double*)data)[numStep-1] = timemax;
00881   }
00882 
00883   return FC_SUCCESS;
00884 }
00885 
00886 /** 
00887  * \ingroup Sequence
00888  * \brief Given an array of sequences on the same dataset, and new
00889  *        bounds, creates a new regularly spaced sequence whose range 
00890  *        is that of the given bounds and whose number of steps is
00891  *        the max number of steps that the input sequences have on that
00892  *        range.
00893  *
00894  * \description
00895  *
00896  *        Given an array of sequences on the same dataset, and new
00897  *        bounds, creates a new regularly spaced sequence whose range 
00898  *        is that of the given bounds and whose number of steps is
00899  *        the max number of steps that the input sequences have on that
00900  *        range. This is similar to fc_getIntersectingReqularSequence with
00901  *        input parameter numStep = 0, but where the range is specified, rather
00902  *        than the entire overlapping range.
00903  *
00904  *        Input sequences must be numerical, but dont
00905  *        have to be same datatype. Input sequences must be 
00906  *        monotonically increasing. New seq data type is FC_DT_DOUBLE.
00907  *        The bounds must be included within every input sequence.
00908  *
00909  *        This routine is often used as a companion function to 
00910  *        functions in the timeseries module. This function creates
00911  *        a common sequence for two or more sequence variables. The
00912  *        old variables can be put on the new sequence
00913  *        using fc_LinearInterpolation and then used in the comparison
00914  *        routines in the timeseries module.
00915  *
00916  * \todo
00917  *     see if can combine this with rc_getIntersectingRegularSequence 
00918  *
00919  * \modifications  
00920  *    - 6/27/05 ACG created.
00921  */
00922 FC_ReturnCode fc_createIntersectingRangeRegularSequence(
00923   int numseqs,/**< input - num of seqs in orig sequence array */
00924   FC_Sequence *seqs,/**< input - orig sequence array */
00925   double seqmin,/**< input - min val for new sequence */
00926   double seqmax,/**< input - max val for new sequence */
00927   char* seqName, /**<input - name of created sequence */
00928   FC_Sequence *seq /**< output - handle to the new sequence */
00929   ){
00930 
00931   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00932   FC_Dataset dset, dsetcomp;
00933   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
00934   double closemintime, closemaxtime, timespacing;
00935   int closeminindex, closemaxindex;
00936   void *data;
00937   int numStep, holdnpts;
00938   int mono;
00939   FC_DataType datatype;
00940   int i;
00941 
00942   if (seq)
00943     *seq = FC_NULL_SEQUENCE;
00944 
00945   if (!seqName || !seq || seqmin > seqmax || numseqs < 1 || !seqs){
00946     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00947     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00948   }
00949 
00950 
00951   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating Intersecting Range regular sequence");
00952 
00953   //checks
00954 
00955   if (!fc_isSequenceValid(seqs[0])){
00956     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00957     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00958   };
00959 
00960   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(seqs[0], &numStep,&datatype);
00961   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00962     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq info");
00963     return FC_ERROR;
00964   }
00965 
00966   if (datatype != FC_DT_INT && datatype != FC_DT_FLOAT &&
00967       datatype != FC_DT_DOUBLE){
00968     fc_printfErrorMessage("Invalid sequence datatype");
00969     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00970   }
00971 
00972   rc = fc_getDatasetFromSequence (seqs[0], &dset);
00973   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00974     fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot get dataset from sequence");
00975     return FC_ERROR;
00976   }
00977 
00978   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dset);
00979   if (dsSlot == NULL){
00980     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00981     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00982   }
00983 
00984 
00985   rc = fc_getSequenceMinMaxMono(seqs[0],NULL,NULL,
00986                                 NULL,NULL,&mono);
00987   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00988     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get minmax of sequence");
00989     return FC_ERROR;
00990   }
00991 
00992   if (mono != 1 && mono != 2){
00993     fc_printfErrorMessage("invalid monotonicity for this sequence");
00994     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00995   }
00996 
00997   for (i= 1; i < numseqs; i++){
00998     if (!fc_isSequenceValid(seqs[i])){
00999       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01000       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01001     }
01002     rc = fc_getDatasetFromSequence (seqs[i], &dsetcomp);
01003     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01004       fc_printfErrorMessage("Cannot get dataset from sequence");
01005       return FC_ERROR;
01006     }
01007     
01008     if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(dset,dsetcomp)){
01009       fc_printfErrorMessage("Input sequences not on same dataset");
01010       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01011     } 
01012 
01013     rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(seqs[i], &numStep,&datatype);
01014     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01015       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq info");
01016       return FC_ERROR;
01017     }
01018 
01019     if (datatype != FC_DT_INT && datatype != FC_DT_FLOAT &&
01020         datatype != FC_DT_DOUBLE){
01021       fc_printfErrorMessage("Invalid sequence datatype");
01022       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01023     }
01024 
01025     rc = fc_getSequenceMinMaxMono(seqs[i],NULL,NULL,
01026                                   NULL,NULL,&mono);
01027     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01028       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get minmax of sequence");
01029       return FC_ERROR;
01030     }
01031 
01032     if (mono != 1 && mono != 2){
01033       fc_printfErrorMessage("invalid monotonicity for this sequence");
01034       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01035     }
01036   }
01037 
01038   //finally ok 
01039 
01040   // now get npts and make sure bounds are valid for all exisitng seqs
01041   // know all are monotonically increasing
01042   holdnpts = -1;
01043   for (i= 0 ; i < numseqs; i++){
01044     int npts;
01045     rc = fc_getClosestSequenceValue(seqs[i],"<=",seqmin,&closemintime,
01046                                     &closeminindex);
01047     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01048       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get closest seq val");
01049       return FC_ERROR;
01050     }
01051 
01052     if (closeminindex == -1){
01053       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s","seqmin is out of bounds for input sequence");
01054       return FC_ERROR;
01055     }
01056 
01057     rc = fc_getClosestSequenceValue(seqs[i],">=",seqmax,&closemaxtime,
01058                                     &closemaxindex);
01059     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01060       fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get closest seq val");
01061       return FC_ERROR;
01062     }
01063 
01064     if (closemaxindex == -1){
01065       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s","seqmax is out of bounds for input sequence");
01066       return FC_ERROR;
01067     }
01068         
01069     npts = closemaxindex-closeminindex+1;
01070     if (holdnpts == -1 || npts > holdnpts){
01071       holdnpts = npts;
01072     }
01073   }
01074   numStep = holdnpts;
01075   //now have valid range and numpts
01076 
01077   /*
01078   if (numStep == 1 && !FC_DBL_EQUIV(seqmax,seqmin)){
01079     //got a problem
01080     fc_printfErrorMessage("DEVELOEPR ERROR _ HOW CAN THIS BE ?");
01081     printf("DEVELOEPR ERROR _ HOW CAN THIS BE ?");
01082     return FC_ERROR;
01083   }
01084   */
01085 
01086   //check for zero range sequences
01087   if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(seqmax,seqmin)){
01088     //its realy a single pt sequence
01089     numStep = 1;
01090     timespacing = 0.0; //actually this value doesnt matter
01091   } else {
01092     timespacing= (seqmax-seqmin)/((double)numStep-1);
01093   }
01094 
01095   rc = fc_createRegularSequence(dset,numStep,seqmin, timespacing,
01096                                   seqName, seq);
01097   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01098     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to create reg sequence");
01099     return FC_ERROR;
01100   }
01101   
01102   //just in case there are some roundoff issues, lets explicitly set that
01103   //last point to the seqmax. (this wont be thread safe since playing 
01104   //with the value thats the return val, but i dont think thats a big issue
01105   //right now
01106   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(*seq, &data);
01107   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01108     fc_printfErrorMessage("failed to get seq data");
01109   }else {
01110     ((double*)data)[numStep-1] = seqmax;
01111   }
01112 
01113   return FC_SUCCESS;
01114 }
01115 
01116 //@}
01117 
01118 /** \name Get existing sequences. */
01119 //-------------------------------
01120 //@{
01121 
01122 /**
01123  * \ingroup  Sequence
01124  * \brief  Get the sequences in a dataset.
01125  *
01126  * \description
01127  *  
01128  *    This call returns an array of sequences in the dataset.
01129  *    The caller is responsible for freeing the array of sequence handles.
01130  *
01131  * \modifications
01132  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
01133  *    - 11/21/03 RM, added default return numSeq = -1, and 
01134  *               seqNames = NULL if anything is wrong
01135  *    - 9/8/04 WSK, changed to return sequence handles instead of sequence
01136  *               names.
01137  */
01138 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequences(
01139  FC_Dataset dataset,   /**< input - dataset */
01140  int *numSeq,          /**< output - number of sequences returned */
01141  FC_Sequence **sequences  /**< output - array of sequences */
01142 ) {
01143   int i;
01144   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01145   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01146   
01147   // default returns if something goes wrong
01148   if (numSeq != NULL) 
01149     *numSeq = -1;
01150   if (sequences)
01151     *sequences = NULL;  
01152   
01153   // check input
01154   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
01155   if (dsSlot == NULL || numSeq == NULL || sequences == NULL) {
01156     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01157     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01158   }
01159   
01160   // log message
01161   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting sequences from dataset '%s'",
01162                       dsSlot->header.name);
01163   
01164   // get num sequences
01165   *numSeq = dsSlot->numSeq;
01166   
01167   // get sequences
01168   if (dsSlot->numSeq > 0) {
01169     *sequences = malloc(dsSlot->numSeq*sizeof(FC_Sequence));
01170     if (*sequences == NULL) {
01171       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01172       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01173     }
01174     for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numSeq; i++) {
01175       seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlotFromID(dsSlot->seqIDs[i]);
01176       _FC_GET_HANDLE((*sequences)[i], seqSlot);
01177     }
01178   }
01179   
01180   return FC_SUCCESS;
01181 }
01182 
01183 /**
01184  * \ingroup  Sequence
01185  * \brief  Get the number of sequences in a dataset.
01186  *
01187  * \modifications
01188  *    - 9/28/04 WSK, created
01189  */
01190 FC_ReturnCode fc_getNumSequence(
01191  FC_Dataset dataset,   /**< input - dataset */
01192  int *numSeq           /**< output - number of sequences returned */
01193 ) {
01194   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01195   
01196   // default returns if something goes wrong
01197   if (numSeq != NULL) 
01198     *numSeq = -1;
01199   
01200   // check input
01201   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
01202   if (dsSlot == NULL || numSeq == NULL) {
01203     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01204     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01205   }
01206   
01207   // log message
01208   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting number sequences from dataset '%s'",
01209                       dsSlot->header.name);
01210   
01211   // get num sequences
01212   *numSeq = dsSlot->numSeq;
01213   
01214   return FC_SUCCESS;
01215 }
01216 
01217 /**
01218  * \ingroup  Sequence
01219  * \brief  Get all sequences with a given name from a dataset.
01220  *
01221  * \description
01222  *  
01223  *    Returns all sequences on the dataset with the specified name. 
01224  *
01225  * \modifications  
01226  *   - Nancy Collins  Created.
01227  *   - 2003-MAY-30  W Koegler  Moved getting sequence meta data from
01228  *       _fc_setupDsSlot() to here.
01229  *   - 11/25/03 RM, added default return sequence = \ref FC_NULL_SEQUENCE 
01230  *   - 12/01/03 WSK Changed so it removes an uncommitted sequence
01231  *       from the owning dataset's seqID list.
01232  *   - 12/02/03 RM, added checking for NULL sequence
01233  *   - 12/12/03 RM, eliminated _fc_lookup_seqSlot() and _fc_namematch(),
01234  *       those input checking changed and added into the body of this function
01235  *   - 9/8/03 WSK, changed name and moved to dataset (to be next to
01236  *       fc_getSequences) 
01237  *   - 9/22/06 ACG returns array of matching sequences
01238  */
01239 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceByName(
01240  FC_Dataset dataset,    /**< input - handle for this dataset */
01241  char *seqName,         /**< input - name of sequence to get */
01242  int *numSequences,     /**< output - number of matching sequences */
01243  FC_Sequence **sequences  /**< output - handle for this sequence */ 
01244 ) {
01245   int i;
01246   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01247   _FC_SeqSlot *seqSlot;
01248   FC_Sequence sequence;
01249 
01250   FC_Sequence *lmatch = NULL;
01251   int numlmatch, maxnumlmatch;
01252   
01253   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
01254   if (numSequences)
01255     *numSequences = -1;
01256   if (sequences) 
01257     *sequences = NULL;
01258   
01259   // check input
01260   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(dataset);
01261   if (dsSlot == NULL || seqName == NULL || !sequences || !numSequences ) {
01262     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01263     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01264   }
01265   
01266   // log message
01267   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting sequence '%s'", seqName);
01268 
01269   numlmatch = 0;
01270   maxnumlmatch = 0;
01271   
01272   // look for existing slots with the matching name
01273   for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numSeq; i++) {
01274     seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlotFromID(dsSlot->seqIDs[i]);
01275     if (!strcmp(seqSlot->header.name, seqName)) {
01276       _FC_GET_HANDLE(sequence, seqSlot);
01277 
01278       if (lmatch == NULL){
01279      lmatch = (FC_Sequence*)malloc(sizeof(FC_Sequence));
01280      if (lmatch == NULL){
01281        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01282        return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01283      }
01284      numlmatch = 1;
01285      maxnumlmatch = 1;
01286      lmatch[0] = sequence;
01287       }else{
01288      if(numlmatch == maxnumlmatch){
01289        FC_Sequence *temp;
01290        temp = (FC_Sequence*)realloc(lmatch,(2*numlmatch)*sizeof(FC_Sequence));
01291        if (temp == NULL){
01292          fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01293          return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01294        }
01295        maxnumlmatch*=2;
01296        lmatch = temp;
01297      }
01298      lmatch[numlmatch] = sequence;
01299      numlmatch++;
01300       }
01301     }
01302   }
01303 
01304   *numSequences = numlmatch;
01305   *sequences = lmatch;
01306 
01307   return FC_SUCCESS;
01308 }
01309 
01310 //@}
01311 
01312 /** \name Change the name of a sequence. */
01313 //-------------------------------
01314 //@{
01315 
01316 /**
01317  * \ingroup Sequence
01318  * \brief  Change the name of a sequence.
01319  *
01320  * \modifications
01321  *   - 8/24/2005 WSD. Created.
01322  */
01323 FC_ReturnCode fc_changeSequenceName(
01324   FC_Sequence sequence, /**< Input - the sequence. */
01325   char* newName       /**< Input - new name for the sequence. */
01326 ) {
01327   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01328 
01329   // check input
01330   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01331   if (seqSlot == NULL || newName == NULL) {
01332     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01333     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01334   }
01335 
01336   // log message
01337   fc_printfLogMessage("Changing name of sequence from '%s' to '%s'", 
01338                       seqSlot->header.name, newName);
01339   
01340   // Do it
01341   return _fc_setSlotHeaderName(&seqSlot->header, newName);
01342 }
01343 
01344 //@}
01345 
01346 /** \name Release/delete sequences. */
01347 //-------------------------------
01348 //@{
01349 
01350 /**
01351  * \ingroup  Sequence
01352  * \brief  Attempt to minimize sequence's memory usage.
01353  *
01354  * \description
01355  *  
01356  *    Call to try and release un-needed memory in a  sequence. 
01357  *    If the sequence has been saved to disk, the large data is 
01358  *    released. If the sequence has not been saved to disk, this 
01359  *    will do nothing.
01360  *
01361  * \modifications  
01362  *    - 04/19/04 WSK Created.
01363  */
01364 FC_ReturnCode fc_releaseSequence(
01365  FC_Sequence sequence       /**< input - sequence handle */
01366 ) {
01367   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01368   
01369   // special case: releasing a null handle is not an error
01370   if ( FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(sequence, FC_NULL_SEQUENCE)) {
01371     fc_printfWarningMessage("Releasing FC_NULL_SEQUENCE");
01372     return FC_SUCCESS;
01373   }
01374 
01375   // check input
01376   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01377   if (seqSlot == NULL) {
01378     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01379     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01380   }
01381   
01382   // log message
01383   fc_printfLogMessage("Cleaning up sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
01384 
01385   // remove big data if this slot is committed
01386   if (seqSlot->header.committed == 1) {
01387     free(seqSlot->coords);
01388     seqSlot->coords = NULL;
01389   }
01390 
01391   return FC_SUCCESS;
01392 }
01393 
01394 /**
01395  * \ingroup  Sequence
01396  * \brief  Delete a sequence.
01397  *
01398  * \description
01399  * 
01400  *    Call when this sequence is no longer needed. Deleting a NULL
01401  *    sequence handle is not an error, but trying to delete a sequence if any
01402  *    meshes have a sequence variable on it is an error.  So, delete meshes
01403  *    before deleting sequences.
01404  *
01405  * \modifications  
01406  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
01407  *    - 11/25/03 RM, added more input checking, if sequence is 
01408  *      FC_NULL_SEQUENCE) then do nothing and return 
01409  *      success (issue warning if fc_getLibraryVerbosity()). 
01410  *    - 12/01/03 WSK Changed so it removes an uncommitted sequence
01411  *      form the owning dataset's seqID list.
01412  *    - 9/9/04 WSK changed name to delete. Changed behavior so that
01413  *      delete always deletes no matter whether on disk or not.
01414  */
01415 FC_ReturnCode fc_deleteSequence(
01416  FC_Sequence sequence     /**< input - sequence to be deleted */
01417 ) {
01418   int i, j;
01419   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01420   _FC_DsSlot* dsSlot;
01421   
01422   // special case: deleting a null handle is not an error
01423   if ( FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(sequence, FC_NULL_SEQUENCE)) {
01424     fc_printfWarningMessage("Deleting FC_NULL_SEQUENCE");
01425     return FC_SUCCESS;
01426   }
01427   
01428   // check input
01429   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01430   if (seqSlot == NULL) {
01431     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01432     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01433   }
01434   
01435   // log message
01436   fc_printfLogMessage("Deleting sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
01437 
01438   // setup
01439   dsSlot = _fc_getDsSlot(seqSlot->ds);
01440 
01441   // special case: don't delete if any mesh has a reference to
01442   for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numMesh; i++) {
01443     _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlotFromID(dsSlot->meshIDs[i]);
01444     for (j = 0; j < meshSlot->numSeqVar; j++) {
01445       _FC_VarSlot* varSlot = _fc_getVarSlotFromID(meshSlot->seqVarIDs[j][0]);
01446       if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(sequence, varSlot->sequence)) {
01447         fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't delete sequence '%s' because mesh '%s' "
01448                               "has a reference to it", seqSlot->header.name,
01449                               meshSlot->header.name);
01450         return FC_ERROR;
01451       }
01452     }
01453   }
01454   
01455   // remove reference from parent dataset
01456   if (dsSlot->numSeq == 1) {
01457     free(dsSlot->seqIDs);
01458     dsSlot->seqIDs = NULL;
01459     dsSlot->numSeq = 0;
01460   }
01461   else {
01462     for (i = 0; i < dsSlot->numSeq; i++) {
01463       if (dsSlot->seqIDs[i] == seqSlot->header.slotID)
01464         break;
01465     }
01466     for (j = i+1; j < dsSlot->numSeq; j++) {
01467       dsSlot->seqIDs[j-1] = dsSlot->seqIDs[j];
01468     }
01469     dsSlot->numSeq--;
01470   }
01471 
01472   // clear & delete slot
01473   return _fc_deleteSeqSlot(sequence);
01474 }
01475 
01476 //@}
01477 
01478 /** \name Get sequence metadata. */
01479 //-------------------------------
01480 //@{
01481 
01482 /**
01483  * \ingroup  Sequence
01484  * \brief Check that the handle refers to a valid sequence.
01485  *
01486  * \description
01487  *
01488  *    Returns 1 (true) is the handle is valid, and 0 (false) if it is not.
01489  *
01490  * \modifications  
01491  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Created.
01492  */
01493 int fc_isSequenceValid(
01494   FC_Sequence sequence  /**< input - sequence handle */
01495 ) {
01496   return _fc_isHandleValid(sequence.slotID, sequence.uID, seqTableSize,
01497                            (_FC_SlotHeader**)seqTable);
01498 }
01499 
01500 /**
01501  * \ingroup  Sequence
01502  * \brief  Return name of a sequence.
01503  *
01504  * \description
01505  *  
01506  *    Return the name associated with a sequence handle. Spaced
01507  *    is allocated for the string so it needs to be freed by the
01508  *    user when finished.
01509  *
01510  * \modifications  
01511  *    - Aug, 9, 2002.  W Koegler  Created
01512  *    - 11/25/03 RM, added checking for NULL dataset handle, 
01513  *         default return seqname = NULL if anything is wrong
01514  */
01515 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceName(
01516   FC_Sequence sequence,   /**< input - sequence handle */
01517   char **seqname          /**< output - sequence name, space allocated here
01518                              and must be freed by user when finished */
01519 ) {
01520   char *cp;
01521   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01522   
01523   // default returns if something goes wrong
01524   if (seqname)
01525     *seqname = NULL;  
01526   
01527   // check input
01528   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01529   if (seqSlot == NULL || seqname == NULL) {
01530     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01531     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01532   }
01533   
01534   // log message
01535   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting name for sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
01536 
01537   // copy name
01538   cp = seqSlot->header.name;
01539   *seqname = malloc(strlen(cp) + 1);
01540   if (*seqname == NULL) {
01541     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01542     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01543   }
01544   strcpy(*seqname, cp);
01545   
01546   return FC_SUCCESS;
01547 }

01549 /**
01550  * \ingroup  Sequence
01551  * \brief  Get the parent dataset of the sequence.
01552  *
01553  * \modifications  
01554  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
01555  *    - 11/25/03 RM, added default return dataset = \ref FC_NULL_DATASET
01556  *    - 12/22/03 Rm, added checking for input/output dataset == NULL
01557  */
01558 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDatasetFromSequence(
01559   FC_Sequence sequence,   /**< input - sequence handle */
01560   FC_Dataset *dataset     /**< output - dataset handle */
01561 ) {
01562   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01563   
01564   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
01565   if (dataset != NULL) 
01566     *dataset = FC_NULL_DATASET;
01567   
01568   // check input
01569   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01570   if (seqSlot == NULL || dataset == NULL) {
01571     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01572     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01573   }
01574   
01575   // log message
01576   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting dataset from sequence '%s'", 
01577                       seqSlot->header.name);
01578   
01579   // return requested value
01580   *dataset = seqSlot->ds;
01581   
01582   return FC_SUCCESS;
01583 }
01584 
01585 /**
01586  * \ingroup  Sequence
01587  * \brief  Get information about a sequence.
01588  *
01589  * \description
01590  *  
01591  *    Return the number of steps in a sequence, and the datatype of the
01592  *    sequences coordinates.
01593  *
01594  * \modifications 
01595  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
01596  *    - 2003-APR-18  W Koegler  Finishing sequence implementation
01597  *    - 11/25/03 RM, added default return numStep = -1, datatype = 
01598  *      \ref FC_DT_UNKNOWN
01599  */
01600 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceInfo(
01601   FC_Sequence sequence,   /**< input - sequence handle */
01602   int *numStep,           /**< output - number of steps in the sequence */
01603   FC_DataType *datatype   /**< output - data type of sequence coordinates */
01604 ) {
01605   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01606   
01607   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
01608   if (numStep != NULL) 
01609     *numStep = -1 ;
01610   if (datatype != NULL)
01611     *datatype = FC_DT_UNKNOWN;
01612   
01613   // check input
01614   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01615   if (seqSlot == NULL || (!numStep && !datatype)) {
01616     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01617     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01618   }
01619   
01620   // log message
01621   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting info for sequence '%s'", 
01622                       seqSlot->header.name);
01623   
01624   // fill in requested values
01625   if (numStep)
01626     *numStep = seqSlot->numStep;
01627   if (datatype)
01628     *datatype = seqSlot->datatype;
01629   
01630   return FC_SUCCESS;
01631 }
01632

01634  * \ingroup  Sequence
01635  * \brief  Get number of steps in a sequence.

01639  */
01640 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceNumStep(

01643 ) {

01648     *numStep = -1 ;
01649   
01650   // check input
01651   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01652   if (seqSlot == NULL || !numStep) {
01653     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01654     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01655   }
01656   
01657   // log message
01658   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting numStep for sequence '%s'", 
01659                       seqSlot->header.name);
01660   
01661   // fill in requested values
01662   if (numStep)
01663     *numStep = seqSlot->numStep;
01664   
01665   return FC_SUCCESS;
01666 }
01667

01702 
01703 //@}
01704 
01705 /** \name Get sequence big data. */
01706 //-------------------------------
01707 //@{
01708 
01709 /**
01710  * \ingroup  Sequence
01711  * \brief  Get sequence coordinates
01712  *
01713  * \description
01714  *  
01715  *    Return a pointer to the sequence's coordinate array. This
01716  *    must be treated as read-only.
01717  *
01718  * \modifications 
01719  *   - Nancy Collins Created.
01720  *   - 2003-APR-18  W Koegler  Finishing sequence implementation
01721  *   - 11/25/03 RM, added checking for NULL sequence handle, 
01722  *         default return *coords = NULL, issue an error if 
01723  *         fc_getLibraryVerbosity()
01724  */
01725 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(
01726   FC_Sequence sequence,   /**< input - sequence handle */
01727   void **coords_p         /**< output - pointer to coord array */
01728   ) {
01729   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01730   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01731   
01732   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
01733   if (coords_p)
01734     *coords_p = NULL;
01735   
01736   // check input
01737   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01738   if (seqSlot == NULL || coords_p == NULL) {
01739     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01740     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01741   }
01742   
01743   // log message
01744   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting coords for sequence '%s'", 
01745                       seqSlot->header.name);
01746   
01747   // lazy fetching of sequence coords done here
01748   if (seqSlot->coords == NULL && seqSlot->numStep > 0) {
01749     rc = _fc_readSequenceCoords(sequence);
01750     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01751       fc_printfErrorMessage("Lazy loading of coords of sequence '%s' failed",
01752                             seqSlot->header.name);
01753       return rc;
01754     }
01755   }
01756   
01757   // set return values
01758   *coords_p = seqSlot->coords;
01759   
01760   return FC_SUCCESS;
01761 }
01762 
01763 
01764 /**
01765  * \ingroup  Sequence
01766  * \brief  Get a copy of the sequence's coords as the requested data type
01767  *
01768  * \description
01769  *  
01770  *    Returns the sequence's data as the type requested by the user.
01771  *    The user is responsible for freeing the array. The routine casts
01772  *    to the requested user type so there is a potential for lost information
01773  *    (e.g. if you cast a floating point number to int it is truncated, not
01774  *    rounded).
01775  *
01776  *    If you are worried about memory or casting, you should use
01777  *    fc_getVariableDataPtr() to get a pointer to the raw data array.
01778  *
01779  * \modifications
01780  *   - 06/09/2006 WSD Created.
01781  */
01782 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSequenceCoordsAsDataType(
01783   FC_Sequence sequence,   /**< input - sequence handle */
01784   FC_DataType dataType,   /**< input - the data type for the returned coords */
01785   void **coords           /**< output - pointer to coord array */
01786   ) {
01787   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01788   int i;
01789   int numStep;
01790   FC_DataType dataType_orig;
01791   void* coords_orig;
01792   
01793   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
01794   if (coords)
01795     *coords = NULL;
01796   
01797   // check input
01798   if (!fc_isSequenceValid(sequence) || !fc_isDataTypeValid(dataType) ||
01799       dataType == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || coords == NULL) {
01800     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01801     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01802   }
01803   
01804   // log message
01805   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting coords for sequence '%s' as type %s", 
01806                 _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence)->header.name,
01807                 fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
01808   
01809   // get sequence info and coords
01810   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(sequence, &numStep, &dataType_orig);
01811   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01812     return rc;
01813   rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(sequence, &coords_orig);
01814   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01815     return rc;
01816 
01817   // allocate return array
01818   *coords = malloc(numStep*fc_sizeofDataType(dataType));
01819   if (!*coords) {
01820     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01821     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01822   }
01823   
01824   // special case - the same data type
01825   if (dataType == dataType_orig) {
01826     memcpy(*coords, coords_orig, numStep*fc_sizeofDataType(dataType));
01827     return FC_SUCCESS;
01828   }
01829 
01830   // Fun!
01831   if (dataType == FC_DT_CHAR) {
01832     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_INT) 
01833       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01834         ((char*)(*coords))[i] = ((int*)coords_orig)[i];
01835     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_FLOAT) 
01836       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01837         ((char*)(*coords))[i] = ((float*)coords_orig)[i];
01838     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_DOUBLE) 
01839       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01840         ((char*)(*coords))[i] = ((double*)coords_orig)[i];
01841   }
01842   else if (dataType == FC_DT_INT) {
01843     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_CHAR) 
01844       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01845         ((int*)(*coords))[i] = ((char*)coords_orig)[i];
01846     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_FLOAT) 
01847       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01848         ((int*)(*coords))[i] = ((float*)coords_orig)[i];
01849     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_DOUBLE) 
01850       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01851         ((int*)(*coords))[i] = ((double*)coords_orig)[i];
01852   }
01853   else if (dataType == FC_DT_FLOAT) {
01854     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_CHAR) 
01855       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01856         ((float*)(*coords))[i] = ((char*)coords_orig)[i];
01857     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_INT) 
01858       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01859         ((float*)(*coords))[i] = ((int*)coords_orig)[i];
01860     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_DOUBLE) 
01861       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01862         ((float*)(*coords))[i] = ((double*)coords_orig)[i];
01863   }
01864   else if (dataType == FC_DT_DOUBLE) {
01865     if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_CHAR) 
01866       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01867         ((double*)(*coords))[i] = ((char*)coords_orig)[i];
01868     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_INT) 
01869       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01870         ((double*)(*coords))[i] = ((int*)coords_orig)[i];
01871     else if (dataType_orig == FC_DT_FLOAT) 
01872       for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01873         ((double*)(*coords))[i] = ((float*)coords_orig)[i];
01874   }
01875 
01876   return FC_SUCCESS;
01877 }
01878 
01879 //@}
01880 
01881 /** \name Print sequence. */
01882 //-------------------------------
01883 //@{
01884 
01885 /**
01886  * \ingroup  Sequence
01887  * \brief Print sequence meta data to stdout, and optionally the coordinates.
01888  *
01889  * \modifications 
01890  *    - 11/20/03 WSK Created.
01891  *    - 10/31/07 ACG optional precision flag
01892  */
01893 FC_ReturnCode fc_printSequence(
01894   FC_Sequence sequence, /**< input - sequence */
01895   char* label,          /**< input - label to prepend variable name with, 
01896                                      can be NULL */
01897   int print_coords      /**< input - 1 = print the coordinates. 
01898                   2 = print the in exponential notation with 5 digits of precision */
01899 ) {
01900   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01901   int i;
01902   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
01903   int numStep;
01904   FC_DataType dataType;
01905   void* dbuf;
01906 
01907   // special case: printing a null handle is not an error
01908   if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(sequence, FC_NULL_SEQUENCE)) {
01909     printf("Sequence: FC_NULL_SEQUENCE\n");
01910     fflush(NULL);
01911     return FC_SUCCESS;
01912   }
01913 
01914   // check input
01915   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
01916   if (seqSlot == NULL) {
01917     fc_printfWarningMessage("Deleting FC_NULL_DATASET");
01918     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01919   }
01920 
01921   // log message
01922   fc_printfLogMessage("Printing sequence '%s'", seqSlot->header.name);
01923 
01924   // print label & var name
01925   if (label)
01926     printf("%s: ", label);
01927   else
01928     printf("Sequence: ");
01929   printf("'%s'\n", seqSlot->header.name);
01930   fflush(NULL);
01931 
01932   // print meta data
01933   rc = fc_getSequenceInfo(sequence, &numStep, &dataType);
01934   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01935     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get info for sequence '%s'",
01936                           seqSlot->header.name);
01937     return rc;
01938   }
01939   printf("%snumStep = %d, dataType = %s\n", INDENT_STR, numStep,
01940          fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
01941   fflush(NULL);
01942 
01943   // print coordinates
01944   if (print_coords) {
01945     rc = fc_getSequenceCoordsPtr(sequence, &dbuf);
01946     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
01947       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get coords for sequence '%s'",
01948                           seqSlot->header.name);
01949       return rc;
01950     }
01951     
01952     // print the coordinates
01953     printf("%sCoordinates:\n", INDENT_STR);
01954     fflush(NULL);
01955     switch (dataType) {
01956     case FC_DT_CHAR: 
01957       {
01958         char* cast_buf = (char *)dbuf;
01959         for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++)
01960           printf("%s%s%d:  %c\n", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i, cast_buf[i]);
01961       }
01962       break;
01963     case FC_DT_INT:
01964       {
01965         int* cast_buf = (int *)dbuf;
01966         for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) 
01967           printf("%s%s%d:  %d\n", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i, cast_buf[i]);
01968       }
01969       break;
01970     case FC_DT_FLOAT:
01971       {
01972         float* cast_buf = (float *)dbuf;
01973         for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) 
01974           printf("%s%s%d:  %.6g\n", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i, cast_buf[i]);
01975       }
01976       break;
01977     case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
01978       {
01979         double* cast_buf = (double *)dbuf;
01980         for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) 
01981        switch(print_coords){
01982        case 2:
01983          printf("%s%s%d:  %5leg\n", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i, cast_buf[i]);
01984          break;
01985        default:
01986          printf("%s%s%d:  %.15g\n", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i, cast_buf[i]);
01987          break;
01988        }
01989       }
01990       break;
01991     case FC_DT_UNKNOWN:
01992       printf("Cannot print data type '%s'\n", fc_getDataTypeText(dataType));
01993     }
01994     fflush(NULL);
01995   }
01996 
01997   return FC_SUCCESS;
01998 }
01999

02002 /**
02003  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02004  * \brief  Initialize a sequence slot
02005  *
02006  * \modifications  
02007  *   APR-30-2003  W Koegler  Created.
02008  */
02009 void _fc_initSeqSlot(
02010   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot    /**< input - the qtable slot to initialize */
02011 ) {
02012   if (seqSlot != NULL) {
02013     _fc_initSlotHeader(&seqSlot->header);
02014     seqSlot->ds = FC_NULL_DATASET;
02015     seqSlot->numStep = 0;
02016     seqSlot->datatype = FC_DT_UNKNOWN;
02017     seqSlot->coords = NULL;
02018   }   
02019 }
02020 
02021 /**
02022  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02023  * \brief  Release non-necessary resources in a sequence slot.
02024  *
02025  * \description
02026  *  
02027  *    Releases the coordinates.
02028  *
02029  * \modifications  
02030  *   2003-APR-17  W Koegler  Created
02031  */
02032 void _fc_releaseSeqSlot(
02033   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlotp    /**< input - qtable pointer */
02034 ) {
02035 
02036   // release big data
02037   if (seqSlotp->coords)
02038     free(seqSlotp->coords);
02039   seqSlotp->coords = NULL;
02040     
02041   return;
02042 }
02043 
02044 /**
02045  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02046  * \brief  Clear a sequence slot.
02047  *
02048  * \description
02049  *  
02050  *    Releases all dynamically allocated resources in a sequence,
02051  *    and reinitializes all members.
02052  *
02053  * \modifications  
02054  *   - 2003-APR-17  W Koegler  Created
02055  *   - 2003-APR-31  W Koegler  Made more comprehensive
02056  */
02057 void _fc_clearSeqSlot(
02058  _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlotp       /**< input - qtable pointer */
02059 ) {
02060   if (seqSlotp != NULL) {
02061     // release big data
02062     _fc_releaseSeqSlot(seqSlotp);
02063 
02064     // free other dynamic arrays, if any
02065 
02066     // clear table header
02067     _fc_clearSlotHeader(&seqSlotp->header);
02068 
02069     // reinit
02070     _fc_initSeqSlot(seqSlotp);
02071   }
02072 }
02073 
02074 /**
02075  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02076  * \brief  Get the size of the sequence table.
02077  *
02078  * \modifications  
02079  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
02080  */
02081 int _fc_getSeqTableSize() {
02082   return seqTableSize;
02083 }
02084 
02085 /**
02086  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02087  * \brief   Get an empty sequence slot from the sequence table.
02088  *
02089  * \description
02090  *  
02091  *    Will return a new slot or NULL. A NULL means a memory error occurred.
02092  *
02093  * \modifications  
02094  *    - 2003-MAY-01  W Koegler  Created
02095  *    - 12/08/03 WSK Changed because changed XTables from arrays of slots
02096  *      to arrays of handles to slots. The _fc_new_XSlot() routines do
02097  *      not call a common helper routine anymore.
02098  *    - 5/11/04 WSK  Moved common code from _fc_getNewDsSlot(), 
02099  *      _fc_getNewSeqSlot(), etc to _fc_getNewSlot().
02100  */
02101 _FC_SeqSlot* _fc_getNewSeqSlot() {
02102   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
02103 
02104   seqSlot = (_FC_SeqSlot*) _fc_getNewSlot(&seqTableSize, 
02105                            (_FC_SlotHeader***)&seqTable, 
02106                            &seqOpenSlots, sizeof(_FC_SeqSlot));
02107   _fc_initSeqSlot(seqSlot);
02108 
02109   return seqSlot;
02110 }
02111 
02112 /**
02113  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02114  * \brief Get a sequence slot from a sequence handle.
02115  *
02116  * \description
02117  *g 
02118  *    The slot id of the sequence handle is used to find the
02119  *    the slot in the sequence table. The identity is then
02120  *    verified by checking that the slot and the handle's
02121  *    uIDs are the same. On success, a pointer to the slot 
02122  *    is returned. Otherwise a NULL pointer is returned.
02123  *
02124  * \modifications 
02125  *   - 2003-OCT-19  WSK  Created to replace using _fc_checkhandle and GET_ID 
02126  *       for better type checking (using pointer's to slots is less bug
02127  *       prone than lot's of xxxTable[xxxID] references).
02128  *   - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_isHandleValid common to all tables.
02129  */
02130 _FC_SeqSlot* _fc_getSeqSlot(
02131   FC_Sequence sequence    /**< input - sequence */
02132 ) {
02133   if (_fc_isHandleValid(sequence.slotID, sequence.uID, seqTableSize,
02134                         (_FC_SlotHeader**)seqTable))
02135     return seqTable[sequence.slotID];
02136   else
02137     return NULL;
02138 }
02139 
02140 /**
02141  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02142  *
02143  * \brief Get a sequence slot based on ID.
02144  *
02145  * \description
02146  * 
02147  *    The _FC_SeqSlot at the requested slotID is returned. This should
02148  *    only be used when you really know that it is the slot you want
02149  *    because there is no checking of the uID like with _fc_getSeqSlot.
02150  *    The only checking is that the slotID is exists in the table and
02151  *    that the uID is > 0 (i.e. it is not empty).
02152  *
02153  * \modifications 
02154  *    - 11/27/03 WSK Created so that external routines can index into
02155  *      tables without knowing about them.
02156  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_getSlot() common to all tables.
02157  */
02158 _FC_SeqSlot* _fc_getSeqSlotFromID(
02159   int seqID
02160 ) {
02161   return (_FC_SeqSlot*) _fc_getSlot(seqID, seqTableSize, 
02162                                     (_FC_SlotHeader**)seqTable);
02163 }
02164 
02165 /**
02166  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02167  * \brief Delete the sequence slot associated with the sequence handle.
02168  *
02169  * \description 
02170  *    
02171  *    This routine clears the dynamic data in the slot and then
02172  *    deletes the slot from the table.
02173  *
02174  * \modifications
02175  *   - 12/20/2005 WSD. Created.
02176  */
02177 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteSeqSlot(
02178   FC_Sequence sequence    /**< input - sequence */
02179 ) {
02180   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
02181   
02182   seqSlot = _fc_getSeqSlot(sequence);
02183   if (seqSlot == NULL) {
02184     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02185     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02186   }
02187 
02188   // do it
02189   _fc_clearSeqSlot(seqSlot);
02190   return _fc_deleteSlot(seqSlot->header.slotID, seqTableSize, 
02191                (_FC_SlotHeader**)seqTable, &seqOpenSlots);
02192 }
02193 
02194 /**
02195  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02196  * \brief  Print the contents of the Sequence Table (\ref seqTable) to stderr.
02197  *
02198  * \description
02199  *
02200  *    Prints the contents of the Sequence Table in a human readable form.
02201  *    It takes a string to use as a label for this print out of the table.
02202  *    Pass NULL if you don't want a label.
02203  *
02204  * \modifications 
02205  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
02206  *    - 2003-NOV-13  WSK  Fixed up.
02207  */
02208 void _fc_printSeqTable(
02209   char *label  /**< Input - label for this version the table (without a
02210                            trailing \\n) pass NULL if no label is desired */
02211 ) {
02212   int i;
02213   _FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot;
02214   
02215   // print table heading
02216   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
02217   fprintf(stderr, "Sequence Table (seqTable):\n");
02218   if (label != NULL)
02219     fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", label);
02220   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
02221   fflush(NULL);
02222 
02223   // We're done if it's empty
02224   if (seqTableSize < 1) {
02225     fprintf(stderr, "(empty)\n");
02226     fprintf(stderr, "\n");
02227     fflush(NULL);
02228     return;
02229   }
02230 
02231   // print contents for each slot
02232   for (i = 0; i < seqTableSize; i++) {
02233     seqSlot = seqTable[i];
02234     fprintf(stderr, "%3d: %s\n", i, (seqSlot) ? "exists" : "NULL");
02235     if (seqSlot == NULL)
02236       continue;
02237     _fc_printSlotHeader(seqSlot->header);
02238     fprintf(stderr, "     FC_Dataset = { %d, %d }\n",
02239             seqSlot->ds.slotID, seqSlot->ds.uID);
02240     fprintf(stderr, "     numStep = %d, datatype = %s, coords = %s\n", 
02241             seqSlot->numStep, fc_getDataTypeText(seqSlot->datatype),
02242             (seqSlot->coords) ? "exists" : "NULL");
02243   }
02244   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
02245   fflush(NULL);
02246 
02247   return;
02248 }
02249 
02250 /**
02251  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
02252  * \brief  Free all entries in the sequence table
02253  *
02254  * \description
02255  *
02256  *    This should only be called after making sure that
02257  *    all slots have been cleared.
02258  *
02259  * \modifications  
02260  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
02261  */
02262 void _fc_freeSeqTable() {
02263   int i;
02264   for (i = 0; i < seqTableSize; i++) {
02265     _fc_clearSeqSlot(seqTable[i]);
02266     free(seqTable[i]);
02267   }
02268   free(seqTable);
02269   fc_freeSortedIntArray(&seqOpenSlots);
02270   seqTableSize = 0;
02271   seqTable = NULL;
02272 }
